0.Pros: Free food at all times, Could pick up hours whenever I wanted, even in another store in the companies franchised stores.
0.Cons: Very bad pay for the work performed.Severe lack of training for certain parts of the restaurantExpectation of not having a life outside of work.

1.Pros: McDonald's is a great experience workplace. You can build up experience and some side cash for about a year part-time, and find another job to work up the food chain.
1.Cons: The smell. It just gets sickening after a while. Jesus some more ventilation would go a long way.

2.Pros: Great benefits/ Chance for advancement depending on the department you work in.
2.Cons: No clear or concise job assignments and no structure for back-up even though policies are in place, tools are available. You can't use a tool for what it is designed for if you don't know what it is designed for.

3.Pros: Good hours and it's good experience if you want to get good experience with customer service
3.Cons: It's busy and some customers are rude and don't understand that you are just trying to do your job..

4.Pros: Flexibility in schedule was much appreciated
4.Cons: The pay was a bit on the lower end.

5.Pros: Helped pay the bills during high school.
5.Cons: Bad hours for students sometimes, just depended on who made them. and if they cared about your preferences.

6.Pros: they hire everybody and they come off as nice at first
6.Cons: they put their employees down and then fire them when they dont think they are trying hard enough

7.Cons: Too much pressure, Little support from coworkers

8.Cons: some managers are really bossy but it's a nice work enviroment

9.Pros: Good experience for a first jobNot hard you learn as you goMost of the crew is greatFree meals on breaks
9.Cons: It's fast food so it's always busy.You have to clean fast and a large area.Some workers can get on your nervesPay could be better
